metadata.synopsis: An NPC wants to arrest a player for committing a crime (the NPC saw you commit the crime, or another NPC told them you did it). We have custom greeting nodes for the common crime types, and also fallbacks in case there is no prison, or in case this crime happens while the player was already in prison.

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *Someone caught you stealing. Best give them a good reason not to kill you.*
2.context: InternalNodeContext: Only for trespassing, harder persuasion checks than talking your way out of it

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *Your bad behaviour caught this guard's eye. What do you have to say?*
4.context: InternalNodeContext: Only for trespassing, harder persuasion checks than talking your way out of it

92.speaker: Player
92.context: InternalNodeContext: Only for trespassing, harder persuasion checks than talking your way out of it

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Try to talk your way out of it.
53.context: InternalNodeContext: Only for trespassing, harder persuasion checks than talking your way out of it

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Would you look at that - my map's upside down! I should have turned right at that crossroads...

40.text: *Your conviction is enough. This will be taken no further. Nonetheless, this area remains forbidden.*

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *Your words are enough to resolve the matter. Still, you need to leave.*

134.speaker: Narrator
134.text: *Best not try that again lest your actions speak louder than your words.*

103.speaker: Player
103.text: You should be asking for my permission to be here. You're. In. My. Way.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: Haven't you ever been turned around on your way to a date with destiny?

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I was trying to save it, but I was too late.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: That was just for starters. Back off, or you're next.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: No need to go causing a fuss over a little accident, is there?

28.speaker: Narrator
28.text: *They believe you - for now. But something tells you they won't be so receptive to your charms again.*

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *You've convinced them, for now. But transgress again, and no amount of talking will get you out of trouble.*

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *You managed to get away with it. Better not try your luck too often.*

72.text: *You try your best, but your best just isn't good enough.*

62.speaker: Narrator
62.text: *If your intention was to make things worse, you certainly succeeded.*

70.speaker: Player
70.text: There's something... unnatural about this body. Get yourself to safety - I'll handle it.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: If I committed murder, I guess I'd have to kill any witnesses, wouldn't I?

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Do I look like a killer to you? I was raised better than that.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: We weren't fighting. I was merely demonstrating a new martial technique.

118.speaker: Player
118.text: Go on. Try me. I'm finished warming up.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: Please. That was barely a scuffle. No need to overreact.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: What spell? That was just a trick of the light.

130.speaker: Player
130.text: Interrupt me again and you'll be needing that spell to open your jaw.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: You know us spellcasting types. Can't help showing off.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: This item was stolen from me! If you'd done your job I wouldn't need to retrieve it!

80.speaker: Player
80.text: What's worth more to you - getting this back, or leaving here alive?

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Since when is it a crime to admire fine craftsmanship? I just wanted a better look.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I was merely admiring the metalwork. I'm something of a locksmith myself.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Want to find out what else I can do with a lockpick? You won't like it.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Far worse goes on around here than lockpicking. Shouldn't you be focused on that?

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Just admiring the mechanism. Nashkel-made, if I'm not mistaken.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Let's test it on you, shall we?

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Why do you even need this trap? Surely you're strong enough to deal with troublemakers yourself?

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I was trying to help. Now you'll never see the benefits of my little incantation.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Mutter guttural syllables as though placing a particularly vile curse.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: It's not like that spell does any real harm. Just makes you feel a bit funny.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I was trying to help. Now you'll never see the benefits of my little spell.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: Mutter guttural syllables as though placing a particularly vile curse.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: It's not like that spell does any real harm. Just makes you feel a bit funny.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: A decorative replica only. I thought the place needed sprucing up.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: You'll wish that trap had caught you by the time I'm done with you.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: No harm done. I'll just pick it up and be on my way.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: There's something... unnatural about this body. Get yourself to safety - I'll handle it.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: If I committed murder, I guess I'd have to kill any witnesses, wouldn't I?

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Do I look like a killer to you? I was raised better than that.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: There's something... unnatural about this body. Get yourself to safety - I'll handle it.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Turn around and walk away. Trust me - you'll live longer.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: I'm sorry - nobody taught me any better. You've shown me the error of my ways.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: I was just testing your observational skills. Congratulations - your eyesight is in full working order.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: This only ends two ways - you leave me alone, or you die. What will it be?

136.speaker: Player
136.text: I'm sorry - nobody taught me any better. You've shown me the error of my ways.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Try to convince them you belong here.
10.context: InternalNodeContext: Only for trespassing, harder persuasion checks than talking your way out of it

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Why are you looking at me like that? I live here.

111.text: *You managed to talk your way in - no easy feat.*

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *Congratulations - you've convinced them to give you access. Now what?*

27.speaker: Player
27.text: That uniform of yours will make a very tasteful bodybag, if you don't get out of my way.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: Better act as if I'm allowed to be here rather than admit you let me get this far.

94.speaker: Narrator
94.text: *Tempting as it is, the guard will not accept a bribe in this case.*

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *Some guards would appreciate your generosity, but not this one. This one prefers old-fashioned justice.*

95.speaker: Narrator
95.text: *Improperly-acquired coin weighs heavy on the conscience. The bribe may have worked this time, but it won't work the next.*

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *You wonder if all your problems could be so easily solved. For now it's enough to have solved this one.*

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *You don't have the gold to buy your way out of this situation.*

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Try to buy your way in. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Try to buy your way in. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

126.speaker: Narrator
126.text: *Trespassing? What trespassing? You were always welcome here.*

14.speaker: Narrator
14.text: *Your light fingers were too heavy this time - you've been caught stealing. What will you do?*
14.context: InternalNodeContext: No BADASSCIVILIAN version because they never start this dialog for murder

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *You were caught casting a forbidden spell. This guard's come to make sure you don't do it again.*
18.context: InternalNodeContext: No BADASSCIVILIAN version because they never start this dialog for murder

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *Destruction of property is a dangerous hobby. This guard has come to remind you of that.*
22.context: InternalNodeContext: No BADASSCIVILIAN version because they never start this dialog for murder

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *You were seen picking a lock. Prison guards are rarely happy to let such behaviour slide.*
23.context: InternalNodeContext: No BADASSCIVILIAN version because they never start this dialog for murder

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *Setting a trap in prison was a bold move. Avoiding a return to your cell will require similar confidence.*
26.context: InternalNodeContext: No BADASSCIVILIAN version because they never start this dialog for murder

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *Violence amongst prisoners is not tolerated. It looks like you're about to learn that the hard way.*
30.context: InternalNodeContext: No BADASSCIVILIAN version because they never start this dialog for murder

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *You've been seen stealing from your cell. It's a low point, but this guard might be about to make things even worse...*
32.context: InternalNodeContext: No BADASSCIVILIAN version because they never start this dialog for murder

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *You've been caught trespassing. Best explain yourself, before this gets out of hand.*
37.context: InternalNodeContext: No BADASSCIVILIAN version because they never start this dialog for murder

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *You were seen committing an assault. This guard appears ready to respond in kind.*
41.context: InternalNodeContext: No BADASSCIVILIAN version because they never start this dialog for murder

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *Your wanton criminality is attracting attention. Perhaps you should defuse the situation, before things turn ugly.*
43.context: InternalNodeContext: No BADASSCIVILIAN version because they never start this dialog for murder

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *Setting that trap has earned you a trip to the cells. This guard appears more than ready to escort you.*
45.context: InternalNodeContext: No BADASSCIVILIAN version because they never start this dialog for murder

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *You were seen picking a lock. Now this guard's picking a fight.*
48.context: InternalNodeContext: No BADASSCIVILIAN version because they never start this dialog for murder

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *Murder is forbidden. Unless you're a guard, in which case it's called meting out justice. You're about to pay for your crimes.*
54.context: InternalNodeContext: No BADASSCIVILIAN version because they never start this dialog for murder

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *You murdered someone in view of a guard. Perhaps unsurprisingly, you're under arrest.*

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *Vandalising your captors' property is one way to get yourself in trouble. Now would be a good time to explain yourself.*

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *Casting a spell like that is dangerous business. When a guard sees you do it, it's usually fatal.*

69.speaker: Narrator
69.text: *Perhaps that spell was an unwise choice, given your current incarceration. This guard clearly thinks so.*

82.speaker: Narrator
82.text: *You were witnessed assaulting someone. You're headed for the cells.*

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *Trespassing in a prison is one way to get yourself arrested. At least you won't have far to walk.*

88.speaker: Narrator
88.text: *Your vandalism is causing considerable anger. It seems this individual is more than ready to put a stop to you.*

91.speaker: Narrator
91.text: *You're stopped by a guard. It seems your presence here is forbidden.*

98.speaker: Narrator
98.text: *You're being arrested for theft. If you have a defence, make it now.*

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *Disarming someone else's trap is a one-way ticket to the cells. This guard seems more than willing to escort you.*

101.speaker: Narrator
101.text: *Getting caught setting a trap was the easy part. Getting away with it will be more of a challenge.*

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: *You've been spotted interfering with a trap. Tread carefully. This guard looks every bit as dangerous.*

112.speaker: Narrator
112.text: *You've been seen disarming a trap. Your incarceration could be heading for a swift and violent end.*

119.speaker: Narrator
119.text: *This is a restricted area. Time to explain yourself, or this guard will be restricting you to a cell.*

120.speaker: Narrator
120.text: *Even in prison, your criminal impulses are enough to anger the guards. You might want to explain yourself.*

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: *You killed another prisoner, and judging by the look in this guard's eye - you're about to be executed for it.*

124.speaker: Narrator
124.text: *You were seen vandalising someone else's property. Now would be a good time to justify your actions.*

127.speaker: Narrator
127.text: *Your violent behaviour is proving unpopular. Tread carefully, or things may get out of hand.*

131.speaker: Narrator
131.text: *This guard caught you picking a lock. Perhaps you'd like to try the lock of your very own cell?*
